metadata.titel_preek: FIFTH SERMON (The Fifth Word: I Thirst)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, in the person of Jesus, enters the state of absolute human lack (thirst/curse) to become the source of eternal life for a self-destructing humanity.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Son of God
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus comes alongside the least and the lost
Jesus the Son of God is the Source of the river
this death that he freely chooses

object.identificatie: The restoration of 'Living Water' (Eternal Life/Healing) to humanity and creation.
tekstueel_bewijs: the gift of the love that will never fail
the river of the water of life

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Scriptural Mandate
tekstueel_bewijs: that the scripture might be fulfilled
the throne of God and of the Lamb

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity ('our human race'), the outcast, and the Church.
tekstueel_bewijs: bought for us by the agony and thirst
given to the church in its sacraments
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the thirsty one).

helper.identificatie: The Sacraments (Blood and Water) and the Holy Spirit (implied in 'led by some power greater than yourselves').
tekstueel_bewijs: the sacrificial blood of the communion cup
the water as the living symbol of baptism
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the help through His own body.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help leading the hearer to the cross.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, the Curse, and Human Greed/Carelessness.
tekstueel_bewijs: a body left hanging on a tree is cursed by God
bent on destroying itself and its beautiful planet
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a moral failing but a 'curse' and a global 'self-destruction' that requires a divine death to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to human suffering (e.g., Flint water crisis).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Justice and care for the 'least and lost' (literal water).
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical obligation is framed as a failure to recognize the 'analogy' of the primary program; the primary program (Christ's thirst) provides the ground for the secondary.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has taken full human nature upon himself
Jesus comes alongside the least and the lost
God gives to our human race
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we thought that was just a metaphor
the religious authorities went to Pilate

voorbeelden: we need to know a passage
I beg you to think about this
It’s human nature to want to find... the source
we don’t understand this metaphor until his hour comes
unable to lift a finger to help himself
the love that will never fail

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on Christ's 'Pouvoir' (His capacity to be the source) precisely through his 'Non-pouvoir' (his weakness on the cross). It is a theology of grace where divine power is gifted to those who cannot help themselves.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From literal water (S2/Non-S2) to the sterile 'just a metaphor' (Non-S1), finally resolving in Christ who unites the literal and the spiritual in the Living Water (S1) by absorbing the Curse (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the 'Thirst' (S2) to open the 'River of Life' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'curse' and 'agony' are central to the narrative engine.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Jesus is the primary actant who acts upon a passive or self-destructive humanity. The 'engine' of the sermon is Christ's substitutionary suffering.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Perhaps some of the officials were churchgoers who never thought to wonder...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the eternal life that God gives to our human race
cursed by God... bent on destroying itself

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Samaritan woman is used as a foil for misunderstanding, not a model for imitation. Christ is the only hero.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Christ meets the outcast in her lack.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the hearer is the beneficiary of a cosmic transaction.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is a 'gift' to be 'found' or 'come to', not earned.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the dystopian story to the biblical text to the eschatological vision is seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: bought for us by the agony and thirst of the only-begotten Son of God

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit 'leads' the hearer to the cross where the 'Pouvoir' (power) is gifted.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'curse' that results in being 'forsaken' and 'outcast'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon correctly positions Christ as the Subject and humanity as the Receiver. The 'Opponent' (The Curse) is sufficiently heavy to necessitate divine intervention.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Devoir' (Moralism) trap.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent is already cosmic (The Curse/Self-destruction).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching. It moves from human lack to divine provision without placing the burden of performance on the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'water' metaphor, Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'engine' is the Subject-switch from the thirsty human to the thirsty God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the hyssop; semiotics explains why Christ *must* be the one acting in the verb 'to give'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the Axis of Transmission (God giving to the race) rather than the Axis of Desire (Man seeking God).

volledige_object_lijst: The river of the water of life
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'thirst' of Christ as a semiotic bridge between human ontological need and divine soteriological provision.
